intro: Crucianella bracteata, commonly known as the bracted crucianella, is a small, herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink and bloom in early spring. Crucianella bracteata is often found in rocky or calcareous soils and is relatively uncommon in the wild.
